responses.rationale: The segment describes the spread of disease but does not report prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment reports a numerical metric '23 states have confirmed cases' using standard descriptive verbs.
The segment reports locations of cases, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment reports a numerical metric '11.7 million turkeys annually' using a standard descriptive verb 'raises'.
The segment reports a numerical metric '46 million chickens' using a standard descriptive verb 'had'.
The segment reports numerical metrics '13 million chickens and 305,000 turkeys' using a standard descriptive verb 'kill'.
The segment reports numerical metrics like '22 million birds' and '1.8 million broiler chickens' using a standard descriptive verb 'kill'.
The segment reports a numerical metric '56 percent of bird flu cases... were fatal' using a standard descriptive verb 'were'.
The segment reports a numerical metric 'one in five milk samples' using a standard descriptive verb 'had'.
The segment reports numerical metrics 'at least one person' and '36 dairy herds' using standard descriptive verbs and factual qualification.
The segment reports numerical metrics '22 million', '13 million', and '18 million' using a standard descriptive verb 'correct'.
The segment reports numerical metrics '22 million', '13 million', and '18 million' using a standard descriptive verb 'correct'.
The segment reports a numerical metric 'at least 26 states' using a standard descriptive verb 'have been found'.
